review: Yes, TGIFriday's is a little unoriginal, but they make up for that with consistency.  I love their happy hour and a great beer selection at this location.  Who can beat Ziegen Bach and appetizers half priced?   I like the bar setup here because they have a TV on every side and the bartenders are really nice.  Great place to meet up with friends on a weeknight to watch the Mavs play.
Great food & service!!!

Been there on a Saturday night and I was wondering why the parking lot was so empty. Normally parking lots in front of good places burst with cars. Well, I was about to find out.  The food was ok, but the service was soooooooooooooooooooooo slow, A restaurant that's merely half full and the food takes so long?  Also the waiter was't that attentive. My husband had to call him several times to get a refill for the soda. How hard can that be. Normally you expect eyes concentrating on tables, evaluating what they need, but not here.  Not too great of an experience. I don't know what happened, last time I was hear was early in the year and it was great. I can't imagine I caught a bad day, or didn't I? Don't know. Unfortunately was disappointing.

Went with my wife on a weeknight. The place was pretty slow with only about 30% of the tables occupied. During our entire stay, we only saw our waiter about four times: once to take our drinks, once to take our orders, once to bring our check and then one more time to return it. We stayed for well over an hour, and it was due to the fact that the service was so poor. Underwhelming food which almost immediately upset our stomachs paired with poor service left us with a bitter taste in our mouths. We love Fridays, but I cannot recommend this one as our experience there was not stellar.

This was the third strike in a row for this Fridays. We were ignored at the door, the greeter didn't acknowledge us for 2-3 mins. Not a good start. When I unrolled my napkin, I noticed the knife was DIRTY. I asked for another which I never received. We ordered food and regret immediately started setting in. We waited for 45+ mins and when it finally came, it was low quality. I felt bad for the waiter - he acknowledged that the kitchen was slow and that he hoped it was going to would get better.

Been a while since we've been, boy what a mistake.  20 minutes for the appetizer .  Burger dry bread stale . Shrimp had a funny taste   Also over cooked.  Bill came , wrong.  Poor service I'm not about to correct a wrong bill, then it was overcharged when I got final receipt.  Girl no tip for you and i'll be contacting corporate.  I could have been a mystery diner. One of the worse meals in a long time.

This use to be one of my favorite places to dine. I'm not really sure what happened... I'll be honest, I stopped going to Fridays because their food got really greasy and salty... Then they tried to revamp the menu, which has a few good items...but nothing really kept my attention. Needless to say, my experience yesterday was in a way the same... My boyfriend had ordered a full rack of ribs. It was caked in a sweet BBQ sauce. Nothing really stood out but nothing particularly "bad" either. I had the Spicy Craft Beer-Cheese Burger - avocado, jalapeños (some of my all-time fave burger toppings). The toppings were great, but the burger was again, nothing special. We ended our dinner with Whiskey Cake. The syrup around it was extremely sweet, making the already sweet cake super-saturated... but the vanilla ice cream made it better! And in the end, our bill was pretty...expensive for what we got...

I am a huge fan of TGI Friday's and I was so disappointed when the one in McKinney, TX closed down.  They have great late night happy hour specials and you can't go wrong with the Sesame Jack Strips, especially when they are half price.  The Jack Daniels burger is really good with the Jack Daniels sauce.  I would have given TGI's 5 stars but it seems as if every time we go to eat here the service is lacking.  The only thing that saves them is the food and the reward program.

The restaurant had very few customers on a Sunday morning. We were promptly seated in  a booth. The cushion needed to be replaced, as we sank almost to the floor. Ask for table seating to avoid this discomfort. Ordered the special which was a "pick two" for $12. Had the lettuce wedge which was good however "wedges" are hard to eat at best. This one was fresh and the lettuce crisp. For an entrée had the fried shrimp (12) which was the second half of the "two for $12". The shrimp were "small to medium" in size. They were okay however not great. The batter was a little sweet for me. French fries were served with the shrimp and the fries were rather crispy. Another in the party has the Parmesan Crust chicken, which was small but good. It was accompanied by a tomato entree which was also good. The menu by the way is extensive and you may need more than a couple of minutes to review all of it. Check carefully the "specials" as some of those items have little or no savings over regular menu prices. The tea was very good. Wait service was excellent and the manager came around to check on our booth. Rest rooms were clean. The entire restaurant is somewhat outdated and reflects the long period of time this particular location has been opened. Parking was right at the front door. Our check was accurate and the check out instant.

Been here about 4 times. We love TGI in general but I'd have to say everytime we come to this one, we sit at the bar. Get service right away, the team works together and we get our food right away. The bar does an awesome job and high five to the food running team as well. When i ate my pasta, i was still hungry and asked if it was too late for the $15 appetizer entree deal, i was pleased to hear the male bartender tell us its not too late at all for $3 heck he said he'd do it too! Id say he goes above and beyond most bartenders. I think a man sitting across from us was being cheap and asking for some type of comp meal & most bartenders dont even care to deal with too much of that, he got questions answered for the man. Cool guy. Forgot his name. Think it was Aaron or something. Anyways We'll be back soon! Always.

I am so thrilled that our waitress decided to serve all our 20 drinks together so I could enjoy a melted margarita without even a hint of tequila to taste. When I sent it back because I'd ordered a frozen margarita, the bartender said I should order a regular margarita. Because that's obviously what I wanted. NOT. And I totally love waiting over a half hour to even order food after that. The servers never brought water to anyone at the table before I left ~40 minutes after arriving. We'd made a reservation in advance, and the restaurant wasn't remotely crowded, so there was no obvious reason why we weren't given decent service. I have NEVER had a good experience at this location and only go every few years when friends drag me.

If only I could give no star.  Went there for team lunch. As there will be about 10 people there, we called in advance to give them a heads up. From the time we sat down, the service was pretty bad. The hostess didn't greet us. We waited for 10 minutes for our waiter to come. The food took over an hour to get to the table from the time we placed an order. An hour! What were you doing? Chasing a cow for meat?!? The restaurant wasn't even remotely crowded. I tried to flag down the waiter, who ignored me a couple of times. Our drinks weren't getting refilled - after an hour and half of sitting down, someone finally came to re-fill our drinks. Some of us had to take the food togo as there wasn't enough time to eat. No apology from the restaurant for the delay on food or bad service. The place smelled like chorine. Overall, the worst $10-20 ever spent.

The food here seems like it is packaged and when your order is heated up and brought to your table. It's not terrible tasting, but not great either. The only reason it gets three stars because of the Pink Punk Cosmo. The bartender brings you a glass filled with cotton candy and then pours the drink as you watch the cotton candy disintegrate. It tastes fantastic. Good work on this one, Fridays.

We used to come here a lot when we lived in the area.  The food is great.  Burgers are great.  I would pass on the steak though.   The service is pretty mediocre at best.  Our waitress forgot we ordered an appetizer and a salad.  It never came and when we asked her she responded by asking us what we had ordered.  What a joke.

I remember when TGI Fridays was great. This location on this day wasn't even good.  The salad was small and all iceberg. The portion on the Jack Daniels chicken was small. The chicken was rubbery.  The service was nothing above average but you could tell the wait staff didn't even want to be there.  And where is the flare? This place was no fun.

I typically hate all Friday's but this one was good.  The only reason I put three stars is because Friday's is gross.  I came here with my family for a birthday and the service was great.  We had a large party and they had no tables for us but within 5 minutes they seated us.  Somehow they made it happen.  The waiter was very friendly and patient plus he had a personality.  I don't love Friday's menu selection so I had to kind of tweak it a bit to have something to eat and drink.  The waiter was totally cool with it and made it happen.  I just wish they would put more healthy items on the menu and some cocktails that are not super sugary!! 5 stars for the waiter and management 3 stars for Friday's

I used to go tgif every ones a week when I live in cali Now I live in plano I found one of my favorite American restaurant nearby my house. I love the service they are very nice event the host he opened the door for us when we came and out too. The foods and drinks ah you can't complain the have really good deal .

It's been YEARS since I last went to a Friday's and I don't know why. Service was mediocre and the margarita was wayy too sweet, but everything else was amazing! Potato skins, french fries, Griled chicken sandwich (with "Jack Daniel's" mayo), and the oreo dessert!!! Sooooooo good. And whatever my bf had was good too. Oh and the restraunt is so cute!

I have not been to this location in about a year.  I won't be returning. The young man at the host stand looked like he was bored out of his mind and had better things to do.  He greeted us with a monotone, unenthusiastic, glare.  It was 5pm, there were abundant open tables but he sat us behind another family so that we could not pull our chairs out without hitting them, also the lower level smelled musty and felt sticky. He brought us a high chair that looked like someone poured a plate of food over it and let it sit overnight.  I was totally disgusted and at that point decided to leave. We went to On The Border not far away and had a clean seat in a normal part of the restaurant and had a great meal!  They also hire better host staff too, maybe someone from TGIF should go down there and see how it's done.

Known this Fridays for 15 years for some reason haven't checked in here.  Unlimited appetizers for 10 is a fun way to done with a group of friends.  Share all of them between the group thru keep Em coming all night

The tone of the restaurant was bored and near empty. Most of the managers just stand around doing, or "checking out" their employees.  We arrived around 5:30pm on a Sunday, and the host seated us right in between 2 other full tables, who quite frankly, we're taking up most of the room and we would barely be able to scoot in with hitting them, plus there were numerous open tables. One of the tables was leaving, so we decided to deal with it.  The food wasn't anything special. I had the marinated chicken and shrimp skillet, and my husband had a stacked burger.  It was just sub-par.  This was our first time to a TGI Fridays, and it will probably be the last.

Well of course...it's a chain, but it's a pretty reliable one! This particular Friday's has been renovated over the years. The thing I do like about Fridays is they are always updating their menu. I love coming here in the summer for their strawberry fields salad. It's a cool spot to come to for birthdays and such. But yes...nevertheless it's still a chain.

Came in at 11:30 do not close till 2am on a Friday night.  Wait staff wasn't too interested in waiting.  Waited by waitress did not refill tea or sodas till end of meal when we asked.  Was surprised we wanted a refill. Menu is just not that good and items ordered were over cooked. The place was not busy. The dipping sauces are unspectacular   Over alll will not come back.
Came in after work, greeted with a smile. Our server was consistent. Great positive atmosphere. Will be back. Quality always consistent!

I have been to this restaurant a lot over the years and will never be again. Last year I went there for the Free Veterans day meal. I never have time to stay and eat because I have a family of 5 to get home to. I asked the waiter if I could get my food to go. He patted me on the shoulder and said anything for you guys no problem. Shook my hand and thanked me for my service. He was about to hand me my food when his manager pulled him aside and began chewing him out. I heard the whole thing. "How are we going to make tip money off these guys! The deal is they come in and buy other stuff and bring people with them so we can make a profit. This isn't a hand out its a money maker. Don't do this again!"    I was shocked to say the least and as a a two time Iraq war veteran not looking for a hand out it made me feel incredibly dirty. He handed me the food I left him a tip and said I was sorry. He shook his hand and said there was no need.  I will not be back there nor will I ever frequent any TGIF ever again. I do not need a free meal. But if you offer one as a thank you for someones service then it should be just that. Horrible service and made me feel incredibly uncomfortable. Most other restaurants let me take the food to go or (wink wink) gave me a doggy bag as soon as I sat down.
Good food but service the service great! Ask for Joe he made our night! Great waiter - funny dude kept us laughing all night
The bartenders there are so friendly, attentive, and deliver your drinks very promptly. Joe, Candice, and Allen are who I usually see and I always receive amazing service :)

I took a date there for weekday lunch back in Oct. and it was a disaster. Date's hamburger showed late and up cold. I ordered a Cobb salad that was OK, but I got to hear about the hamburger, then to have the waitress send the manager to "comp" the burger in an attempt to please my date. At 45 mins on a weekday lunch we had run out of time and there was no fixing it at that  point. Thanks Fridays for extra points with the date when it was me that wanted to go there. Then  I thought I would do the Cobb salad tonight, but alas it was a worse disaster. A partially cooked piece of chicken, half cooked, half raw but warm. Grilled but cooked only on one half of one side. How did you do that? It had some grill color to it so as the waitress pointed out it was not microwaved badly?  Are you cooking half frozen chicken on your grill?  Anyway, I paid in full as I am a stubborn and want what I used to get, not some half ass attempt or comp'ed food that is neither worthy of billing or eating.  So here it is... I let corporate know, and I will be back, Don't take crappy delivery as an excuse for service.  Give feedback directly to corporate if you like your restaurant but have an abysmally bad experience. Then go again, and see what is what. This is a real review by the way, my ticket is #1637 from 6:30PM on January 26th, and I mean business so get your stuff together Fridays and bring me the Cobb salad I am used to getting. Corporate contact for Fridays is:

I like the atmosphere and elevated bar area as you come in. Good music playing on the system.   Drink specials ongoing when I arrived.  Stood at the front for just a bit waiting for someone to come up and seat me. Ended up sitting at the bar. Two bartenders working, sort of busy. Took a bit to get to me, then I sat with the menu closed for about 10 minutes waiting to place an order.  Got the cheese sticks and New York cheddar and bacon burger. Covered with Cajun fried onion straws and a sweet chow chow relish.   Food came out as requested, nice and hot and the burger was tasty.
Just picked up the worst Cobb salad I've had as a to-go order.  Almost no toppings.  I posted a picture here.
Had the new stuffed jalapeños and they were really good. Also had the Jack Daniels ribs and they were amazing!!

Slow service, waited 10 minutes to be seated (place was not busy). Finally after being seated we waited another 10-15 minutes before waitress came and took our order. When I finally got my food, I needed extra ranch and believe it or not could not find our waitress. We had to ask another to help us. Will not be coming back to this place.

Not able to do a half star.  There were four of us that came here for lunch.  I got the California club sandwich  with side of fries. The club very tasty. The fries came out cold but the server Dillion was took care of it pretty quickly  The chicken  skewers were  very good so not else to say here  For some reasons the chicken Cobb salad the chicken was something wrong Manager took care of the bill on that as well as the chicken flat bread.  The service was good thanks Dillion - ask for this guy. Manager was pleasant Anyway I'll try this place another time. Look for future updates
Too bad I can't put half a star but I usually love Fridays but tonight it was bad.  My drink was watered down the bartender was not engaging we had one drink and bounced! Worst service ever!

Shit I hate expecting to have a good night after a along day of work but TGI Fridays took the cake tonight. My waiter Brandon was no exception he tried his best but lack of knowledge and self pride stops him from being a good waiter. Our food was ordered by 9:17 and did not hit the table till 10:06 (not busy for that to happen) Brandon said to be patient it was almost ready I got a Long Island ice tea that was weak and bitter I think the lemon was old. The cheese stick where great my kids loved there Mac and ribs when it came out. My steak was over cooked in sorry I like it mead-rare but it was hard to cut and looked dry so I did not eat it. But I have a dog at home that love it and the rib bones. I paid for my ticket then said something to Jack the manager who looked like he would have tried to make the situation better earlier if the server would have mentioned it. I was not trying to look for a free meal which is why I paid for it but a waist of money heading to Chilis with my favorite waiter Kc thank goodness

Seriously the worst restaurant ever. From now on we'll be driving back to the tgi Fridays off park and Preston (where we used to live and go ALL the time and had NO problems ever!) Tonight we went (against our better judgement) only because we didn't want to drive to another one. We sat in the bar area and after about 5 minutes the manager gave us menus and said our waiter would be right with us. After about 5 more minutes still nobody came so we left. (They weren't busy) Pretty sad when your there 10-15 minutes and the manager is the only one who says a word to you. He could have at least got our drinks started for us. Then as we left the manager watched us walk out. Seriously just the worst.

Went for lunch there today, there was no hostess for 5 min, when she showed up she seated our party of 5 at a table in front of the men's restroom door , which I could accept if they were crowded, but since it was 1:15 the lunch crowd was already gone and there were plenty of other options for seating, then we ordered the endless appetizers that they so highly advertise , they didn't bring them out for 10 minutes then our order took another 30 minutes, stale bun on my burger, I would not recommend this restaurant and I will not be going back

By far the worst service both by management and our server. I arrived and was not greeted  within 7 minutes and had to ask another server for a drink. We did not receive appetizer plates when we received our spinach dip. I had asked another server if he could grab us some appetizer plates. He had stated that he would, and I never received the appetizer plates. We finally received our entrees and could not begin eating since we had not received silverware. I had to get up and ask for silverware, and by this time I was already pretty upset and had asked to speak to a manager. The manager arrived at the table to ask if everything was okay. I explained to him my occurrence and what had happened. The lack of service, and not receiving what I had asked for or was promised.. The manager apologized and said he would have better coaching for his employees. He asked what can I do to fix this? Honestly, a manager should have trained experience and not have to have me tell him what I would like him to fix, and offer to discount my meal for the disturbance. I didn't care to eat my meal. Literally did not touch it to be literal. The fact that I had to pay 16 dollars for an entree and receive this crappy of a service was uncalled for. I receive better service at McDonald's. The server didn't even come to apologize or ask if anything was wrong seeing that the manager had come over to our table and had spoken to us. My brother didn't care to complain since he didn't want to be one of those people. Honestly, if the server had communicated with me that she was busy, or that she forgot.. I would have been fine and understanding. The fact that there are servers just lounging and not attending to customers needs irritates me. If you don't care to work.. Please go home! I won't be coming to this location ever again.

My husband and I were enticed to come due to their commercials with the bottomless appetizers. What they don't tell you is that it only applies to one appetizer. For example, it's not like you can order wings the first time and then order potato skins the next. You just get endless amounts of the same thing over and over again until you get sick of it. However, if you get the boneless wings, you can get a different flavor each time. So in that sense $10 isn't bad. But you can get the variety of endless appetizers with an upgrade of $2. So that's what my hubby got. The flavored were weird and the batter is pretty thick. They weren't the greatest chicken nuggets, yet again they were unlimited. I was disinterested in the same endless app, so I got the strawberry fields salad. It was huge, so it was filling and yummy.  Most likely won't be back in awhile. There's nothing special about this place.

I came here after having seen a commercial on tv for unlimited appetizers for 10 dollars! Oh was I wrong. It's really 12 dollars PER PERSON for unlimited appetizers. 10 PER PERSON for one appetizer over and over. I was willing to at least ask to see if we could share but didn't even get the chance cause the waitress would never come back over. I believe her name was Miranda. MIRANDA needs to be fired!!! She's definitely not doing her job. We sat there for over 30 minutes plenty of time for you to come to your table after 9 o clock with hardly anyone there. Finally I decided to just go. I mean shit she paid full attention to the full table of guys sitting behind us. She never came to help us though. When we got up after not hearing from our waiter for a super long time a girl who wasn't even our waitress asked us if everything was ok we told her that we were done waiting she asked us if we'd wait til she went and got the manager and the manager would give us coupons. I think that's pretty admirable she stepped up when the girl wouldn't do her job. I was half tempted to stay and talk to the manager to get free coupons until I thought about it and realized why would I ever went to come back to this establishment?! I told her no thanks and walked out. It was my first time at one and most definitely my last. I would never recommend this place to anyone. Save your time and go to Chilis at least you'll get service there and be able to order your food!

We headed here for lunch on Sunday late afternoon thinking about their $10/$12 endless appetizer offer.  We hadn't been here for at least 6 months or so.  The first thing that struck me was the parking lot was really dirty!  I don't usually take much notice of the parking lot, but this one really caught my eye with bottles and cans everywhere.  There was also someone sitting in a van in the handicap spot with the car running, during the entire hour+ we were there.  Kind of sketchy. While the endless appetizer offer might sound good, pretty much everything on the allowed appetizer menu (yes, there is a limited menu) consists of bread or potatoes.  Boneless wings are on the menu too.  Not really worth it in my opinion! So, we settled on one of our favorites, fried green beans.  We asked for extra cucumber-wasabi ranch.  The portion we received was miserable.. MUCH less than any other time we've been here.  And no, they could not have been confused and thought it was an "endless appetizer" portion because green bean fries are not on the endless appetizer menu.  What we received was definitely not worth the almost $8 charged.  For entrees, I ordered the cajun shrimp and chicken pasta (no shrimp) and the bf ordered the Jack Daniels mixed grill with chicken and a half rack of ribs, with double mac & cheese.  I was asked if I wanted to buy a breadstick for my pasta for 99 cents.  Really?  Way to nickel and dime me! My pasta entree was a noticeably smaller portion then when we used to come here before.  And it had 2 shrimp in it, like they made it the normal way, realized I didn't want shrimp, and picked (most of) them out.  What if I'd been allergic?  Plus, then my pasta was sorely lacking on chicken.  His meal had a lot of meat, which I did not try.  The mac & cheese was penne pasta with a melted white cheese on top, I tried it and it overwhelmingly tasted like butter.  Gross. Service was good, didn't really have an issue there.  Except, there were WAY more servers than seemed appropriate.  The restaurant was maybe 1/4 to 1/3 full and at one point I saw 10 servers (no joke, I counted) congregating around one of the POS systems.  Maybe it was shift change, but there were so many of them standing around just shooting the shit, that the servers actually working and coming out of the kitchen had to squeeze by them every time.  There's usually a server/manager or two sitting at the table on the side, back by the POS system every time I've been here.  I find that kind of odd as well.  Our bill was higher than I expected and certainly not worth the food we received. Long story short, portions are smaller, prices are higher, and we won't be back anytime soon.  We did not see a manager the entire time we were there and the clear vibe in this restaurant is no one (save for a few dedicated servers) cares.

We were seated and never even acknowledged. No hi be right with you. No drinks. Nothing. After waiting awhile we left. When we told the hostess we didn't get service she was more interested in talking with the other hosts. We even had a gift card that we were given to enjoy a night out but left angry and hungry. Won't be back.

Years ago TGI Fridays was a hopping place with good food.  About three weeks ago I stopped in there to kill time and have dinner.  I ordered the new tacos starters with chicken.  It was like eating nothing.  No chicken but some cabbage.  I was so displeased.  The waitress enticed me into ordering a turkey burger.  It was like eating a rubber patty.  The fries were okay.  All in all, the place sucked as well as the waitress.  I would advise never dining at any TGI Fridays.
The service is almost always bad at every TGI Fridays we've ever been to. But the food is pretty good so it keeps it coming back from time to time.
Want cold food?  Come here. 1 star because our drinks were always filled.  Hostest avoided us and would not seat us even though 4 tables were stocked and ready.

Service was slow. The burger was cold, the steaks were room temperature. The flat iron steak was ordered rare and served medium rare. The ribeye was ordered rare and served medium to medium well at the edges. And did I mention it was slow? At a guess, the flat iron was recooked while the rest sat and waited getting cold.  Beyond that ... The sauce wasn't to my liking, but that's personal preference.  In summation, I think they owe us, and especially that cow, an apology.

First of all, we waited about 30 minutes to get a beverage and we were told that my child's chocolate milk could not be fast because due to employee theft, milk had to be locked up. Then we talked to the manager and asked if there was a problem in the kitchen, since the service was so slow and there were only three tables with cutomers, and he said he didn't think so then walked away. Finally, our food came and my 5 year old was served raw chicken! Unfortunately,  I did not know the chicken was raw until we got home and I had a bite of the leftover chicken. I am completely annoyed and disgusted! I will never eat at this Fridays again. My friend called the manager and he offered to comp just the kids meal, as if that will help if my child gets salmonella poisoning. I am calling corporate.  I have pictures of the chicken but I don't know if I can post them on here. Don't go to this place!!!
Worst service ever. Beer cane out like hot tea. food was good but took 40 minutes and bot even full also no silverware terrible experience keep away from here

The service is great. The food sucks. The service is great, I love the staff  but it does not make up for the mediocre food. I used to work here. And this isnt simply a "disgruntled employee" review. I have been to several different Friday's, and this one is by far the worst. Sure, they cater to all your needs. Any complaints are respected and problems. That being said, there are several problems that I've faced here. As soon as you walk into the restaurant you smell the funk. It smells like mold. I've already witnessed 2 leaks. The macaroni and cheese, seasoned fries, and spinach and artichoke dip are the only things worth eating. I've had the potato skins at this location and they were bitter. (How do you manage to make potato skins bitter?) The fried green beans were not good. And the bacon wrapped jalapeños are ridiculously overpriced for the amount they give you. I've spoken to several people who stopped visiting fridays, but they say about 20 years ago the food actually used to be good. The staff is fantastic. Ask for either of the Michaels, Josh, Heidi or Tara. Those are the strongest servers. I also highly recommend having Justine as your server she is such a sweetheart. I can't know if these guys still work there, but they're amazing. The only reason I'd return to Fridays is to meet the staff.

I ordered my food by phone and hostess told me it would be ready in 10minutes. Get there 40 minutes after the call and ask for my order. No one knew who took the order and said order did not exist that I probably called the wrong place. Then a gentleman came and said he found the order so I had to wait more until they made my Order. Did not even say sorry about the mistake.

If you need Customer Service, this is not a place to dine! I went there and hardly anyone acknowledges that a customer walked in . I ordered my drink and appetizers after literary begging for a menu. When it came to bill me they had overcharged me!! I called for a manager and his first words out of his mouth was,  "are you ready to check out?"  Worst service ever. Great food though.. It's TGI Fridays! Be warned.

Hubs and I are here from Colorado Springs, CO working.  We were so glad to see TGIF because our store closed.  Went in for dinner and drinks. Was bummed that the website couldn't pull up my STRIPES.  Was very impressed that our server, Starla asked her manager, Jessica for help.  Jessica made it possible for me s to redeem some points.  Clean place, Starla was very nice and easy to talk with.  She did a great job!  Clean bathrooms, which are a must for me.  Hubs had the Cajun shrimp/chicken pasta and I had the sizzle chicken/shrimp.  YUM!!!!! Will be back!!!  THANKS!!!
Edible but SO SLOW. Should have guessed when it was totally empty on a Saturday at noon.

I have not been to a Friday's in forever. We placed a to go order. The take out service was acceptable and the food was good. However I will not be patronizing this Friday's or likely antithetical for that matter. TGI Friday's has Posted this location with 30.06 and 30.07 signs prohibiting me from entering the premises while carrying my personal firearm. Thy have made it clear they do not want me in their restaurant and I will honor their request. There are plenty of other places in Plano to eat.
We went for lunch, and our server, Rachel, was a delight! The food was delicious, and the place was clean!

Giving a 2 for service only.  My husband and I stopped in on his birthday this past Saturday.  Not sure what has happened to Friday's, we used to really love coming here but when we get there at 8PM on a Saturday night, obviously business is not going well.   While our server was a peach, the food was probably the worst I've had in a very long time.  We had 3 apps, potato skins, pot stickers, and boneless wings.  Best of the 3 was the pot stickers, which came out between luke wam and cold.  The potato skins were deep fried for some reason and all they tasted of was old, and I mean OLD grease.  WORST ones I have ever had.  The boneless wings were more breading than chicken, and tasted EXACTLY like Tyson Frozen all white meat chicken strips.  I mean EXACTLY.   I am not one to do many reviews, but sometimes I really feel the need and this time was warranted!

Interesting. Very interesting. I remember going to this Fridays as a teen and in my early 20's. Its sad to say service has really gone down since then. After reseating three times and lots of miscommunication among staff, we waited for 20   minutes for the rest of our order- after water- to be taken. We received our alcoholic drinks way after our meal, though we ordered the drinks first. We watched as a guest screamed at one of the bartenders to make her drinks. It was then I realized I wasn't the only one waiting on slow drinks on a slow night. The burger bun was stale and the burger was dry compared to previous experiences at different Friday's. But I think what finally did it was my macaroni cheese side dish.   When ordering, I requested to substitute my fries z with "this", pointing at the picture of crusted, bacon mac 'n cheese side dish. The server noted my request, however it was not met once I received my meal. 10 min later I received my mac n cheese- bacons-less & crust-less. As much as I wanted to complain, I'd had enough and so had my boyfriend (which rarely happens). Warning all ye Yelpers of the great drink specials, decent food, and  horrible service on a Wednesday night at Friday's.

I've been coming to Tgi Fridays since I was real young & usually the food is really good but I guess it's changed since then.. Let's start off with the appetizer we got, the loaded potato skins... ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. greasy, beyond greasy and the cheese looked plopped on top with a few bacon pieces sprinkled on top. It was old tasting, the cheese wasn't fresh it was fake more than likely. And I'm a casual diner too I'm 22 years old and I know what I expect in food at least decent food... My entree wasn't bad! I give that kudos but the server was forgetful and he didn't fill drinks up fast enough. We were a party of about 14 people and my sisters food came out cold! The place was DEAD too and it's Father's Day weekend and a Saturday! I'm talking DEAD. don't go here!

Came in to check out the Rangers game and grab a bite to eat. Jeff the bartender made my afternoon. Recommended some ghost pepper wings (not super hot, but very tasty), recommended the frozen specialty drinks but I'm more of a hard liquor guy so I politely declined. Very friendly and pretty knowledgeable about sports and funny! Recommend going to see him again.
Great little spot for an inexpensive night  out for drinks and dinner. Food was okay for the price and you can't beat the happy hour specials.  Price just right when you on a budget

Excellent service! We were greeted immediately when we walked in. Our server Walhee was great and attentive to our needs. Any time we need something, someone is there to assist. Family friendly restaurant. Love the $4 Long Island!

I think this is owned and operated by 12 year olds. The same ones that make the food. This happening awesome place 5 years ago has been going downhill to the point we won't be back. Food is a step above a TV dinner. Good luck keep the servers attention.

I love to eat out! And go to a great restaurant for the experience. But I must say I'm far from impressed. The menu is limited, it took forever for seating, forever to receive our items, and I even tried to take advantage of the endless apps, but unfortunately was never asked if I wanted to try a different selection once done with the first. I must say this has been my first and last experience on this book!

Very disappointed in Central expressway location. Was expecting the dine-in menu shown here on Yelp and website for TGI Fridays. Just recently ate at TGIs at Atlanta Airport and it was amazing. Miso boneless wings and GHost wings!!! Loved them. And ceasar salad in Atlanta was amazing and totally different from this location. This location has old limited menu. Server said their location was a test store. NOT!! Epic Fail. Cesar salad was terrible. Just regular nasty same'ol wings. So disappointed as was expecting menus and quality we had in Atlanta. Even the Rasberry tea  here was not even close to the one in Atlanta.  Also, service was mediocre At best. When we left we passed our server, she did not even acknowledge us or say thanks for coming.

Went in tonight with a group of coworkers after work. Some of us were very needy because we were starving! but i gotta say Maria took great care of us. Food came out a little slow but it was also really late at night. It was a big group but she handled it great props to her. We all are in the service industry so we understood. We will be coming back to see her for sure!

We decided to go to Friday's for dinner tonight as we haven't been there for a long time.  First, we were told that they no longer have their homemade potato chips; that for our free appetizer, all we could get was their nappy chips and salsa.  We opted out on the free appetizer.  Then, looking at the double-sided laminated menu, we were surprised that one side was drinks and the other side hardly had any food. We left and won't be back. Whoever came up with this menu should be fired. I'm sure we're not the only customers who won't be returning. It's really sad because for years Friday's was one of our favorite restaurants.

A few of us came here on a Saturday night for a quick snack and some drinks before going to a concert. We chose to come here because we expected it to be quick and relatively cheap. When we arrived, this place wasn't even busy. Around 5 tables were occupied and about 4 people were at the bar. We chose to sit at the bar.  First off, the service was terrible. We quickly ordered our food first since it would probably take awhile for it to come out. We just ordered a few appetizers: wings, potato skins, and mozzarella sticks. We then ordered some drinks. The long island iced tea was alright, a little heavy with gin in my opinion. The watermelon drink was not good. Like is tasted fine, it just tasted like juice. I could barely taste the alcohol. It wasn't worth the cost. After finishing two very light drinks and waiting for about 30 minutes, we decided the wait was way too long. We asked the guy working the bar to check on our order. He said they were backed up in the kitchen so our food hasn't even been prepped yet let alone cooked. We decided to cancel our orders and just close the tab. He told us he would be right back... That was definitely a lie. After waiting another 15 minutes, he finally came out...with our food. Um, I told you we were in a hurry and to cancel our order since it was too far down the line. I did not ask you to run in and prep my food as fast as possible and throw it together in a box.  We just decided to take the food anyway since he already brought it out. The food wasn't even good. I've been here a few times, but this just was bad. I mean, I wasn't really surprised since it was made as fast as possible. In conclusion, don't come here if you want a relatively fast meal. I expected the wait to be 20 minutes, but not half an hour plus more time. Get it together, guys.

We went there to give them an opportunity to show that they have changed and sadly they hadn't.  20 minutes for an ice tea (with 5 of them sitting not more than 10 feet away from us before the waitress got them to us although she was told and let them sit, 45 minutes to get a hamburger, multiple tables asking for their food to go since it was taking too long.  When I let a manager know he told me to let him know next time we were in and he would make sure we were taken care of.  I shouldn't have to let a manager know I am there to get "taken care of".  I contacted the corporate headquarters to let them know they still hadn't fixed the problem and it took them 3 days to reply with a form letter saying sorry but not feeling like they meant it.  I would highly recommend going to any of the other restaurants in the area instead of this one if you want decent service.

Came here with a friend and her family for a late dinner and had a terrible experience. We showed up at about 8:40 on a Monday. Yes it was kind of late but Friday's stays open late so we figured it would be fine. We were seated at a table that looked like it hadn't been wiped down in days. It was sticky and had crap all over it. The lady seemed pretty irritated to have to deal with it. Then there was the service.... absolutely terrible. I hate giving bad reviews but dang it, if I spend good money to eat out the least you could do is gwtvour drinks to us in under 20 minutes! 3 waters, a tea, and a margarita.... not difficult. The waitress finally comes back smelling like an ashtray with our drinks. One of our party spilled his margarita by accident and it took a solid 10 minutes for someone to come clean it up! 10 minutes!! Everyone at the bar heard the glass break but they just let it sit.... seriously???  The food took a good 45 minutes which is crazy considering we were the only table in there. My friend's burger was undercooked and my pasta was so burnt it was disgusting.  What a disappointment Friday's.... we won't be back

I hate being negative, but my husband and I had the worst experience here yesterday. We came in for a late lunch (3pm on a Saturday) and got seated right away. We got our waters fairly quickly, and also ordered 2 shots of tequila. It took a solid 15 minutes for the shots to come, and we placed our food order while waiting.  We ordered half pasta orders since it was so late in the afternoon. They food came out and it was laughable to call it a half order. More like a 1/4 order (I know because I've had the full order and it's huge!). Then the "cajun alfredo" tasted more like a slightly hot pesto. There were 2 pieces of chicken TOTAL and 2 shrimps. That's crap.  My husband got the three cheese pasta which should have been called "tomato and garlic chunk pasta." It also had BARELY ANY meat in it, but more than 20 whole cloves of roasted garlic. I'm not exaggerating, we started counting after he at about 5 of them. He always finishes his plate, but not this time.  These dishes were a joke and extremely dissatisfying. We left wishing we had eaten ANYWHERE ELSE. Fridays used to be one of my favorites, but we will NOT be going again any time soon, if ever.  Get your ish together Friday's.

Came here on a Friday around 6 expecting it to be busy.  Boy how times have changed, the parking lot was less than a quarter full, got seated immediately, as there were only a handful of other diners.  The bar looked somewhat busy and in all honestly is probably the only thing keeping this location afloat.  I know there's been a big shift in dining trends, but I'm old enough to remember there being a 30 minute wait on Friday nights to get a table.  Service was friendly, albeit a bit slow which is odd because my server only had one other table.  Menu is fairly limited, some burgers, chicken strips, a pasta dish, sandwiches.  Nothing exciting or innovative.  Bar had a working class neighborhood dive feel.  Interior of building is dated and similar to 80's and 90's are locations.  Good choice if you like classic american food, beer, and simple cocktails.

Worst experience I have ever had!!!!!! Service was absolutely terrible. Took my brother here for his birthday dinner. First off, the place was not even busy, plenty of open tables but we had to wait because they are  "low staff". We finally get seated & don't get service. Took way too long to even get drinks. People all around us were walking out. We should have done the same but it was where the Birthday boy wanted to eat so we stuck it out. But never again!
no service and we've been here 30 minutes! pure  des déchets!!! (GARBAGE). worst service ive ever received.

Extremely poor experience; wrote complaint to corporate office; sent standard sorry for poor visit  reply; general manager sent email; sorry for poor experience, come back for a free meal; wrote him back, appreciated apology, never setting foot in that restaurant again! Dirty table, waitress had little experience, no broccoli, no guacamole, no general manager on duty. Waitress went outside to smoke; saw her and smelt smoke on her, did not refill drinks, food took over 30 minutes to arrive and was poorly cooked. no wonder the place was empty!

i have had multiple bad experiences at this specific location of friday's and can easily say i won't be back. each visit i have had here over the last few months has been nearly the same; it starts with arriving to an empty host stand and waiting sometimes minutes for someone to show up and seat you in the near empty restaurant, followed by a server showing up quickly to take your drink order and then making you wait twenty minutes to get the drinks.  food is a complete other story. while it normally TASTES perfectly fine, it takes nearly an hour to receive. that in itself can be annoying, but it's worsened by the fact that the wait staff actively avoids your table while you're waiting -- almost like they're afraid you're going to ask about your food and they don't have an answer. this leaves time for your drink to go empty and not be refilled until you've gotten your food or ten minutes after.  tonight specifically i waited 45 minutes for a steak plate which was delivered to me barely warm. overall, i find myself incredibly frustrated and upset every time i leave this location. for the price of their food, the service is absolutely terrible and that upsets me because i really do love their food.  friday's, please train your staff or kitchen a little more thoroughly because there's no reason anyone should have to wait an hour for their food in a restaurant with six total tables

Two major problems occurred during our visit to this TGIF restaurant last night: 1) I have dietary restrictions and cannot eat pork or bacon. We ordered the pretzel appetizer and both the dips had pork or bacon in it. It did not say on the menu that it would. When I asked my server, he wasn't aware of it. It was only after we were done with the appetizer that we were told of pork and bacon being present in both dips.  2) The entree that I ordered was Blackened Mahi Mahi. The rice were so bad, they were almost smelling foul. I didn't send it back since we were told that the kitchen would close within 15 minutes of our arrival (we arrived at 1 AM). Also, the entree size for too small for a dinner portion.

I love some Fridays food but MAN is this location horrible. I literally stood at the front for a good 15 minutes until a man who was looking for his date at the bar called me over mistaking me for his date.  Then someone came down the stairs and the only way I knew they we're an employee was by their badge so I had to ask if they we're one and if it was self seating. She apologized and said there was no hostess tonight and seated me and cleaned my table while I went to the restroom.  I had to wait another 20 minutes to have my order taken even though she had told me my servers name "Coulter" and he had no problem serving the big parties around me that we're predominantly caucasian. Finally he came to take my drink order and that took a little of a shorter time to come out and when he dropped it off he was going to walk away and I told him I was ready to order since obviously he didn't care.  While I waited for my food I saw staff walking around eating, talking, looking overall confused and honestly high and the manager who was young had to offer the table near me a dessert because of a mistake.  He then forgot to bring it out and apologized when he finally did.  This place has young management and it shows. No worries about me spending my money here.
First time here.  Visiting from austin.  Great atmosphere and Barb the bartender was awesome!  Very welcoming and always checking on me!!!  Thanks!!!!!

My experience with this location was not good!  Why put a hostess who acts as though she would rather be somewhere else greeting the public?? I am first greeted by "oh it's just you... you can go sit at the bar" (the place is almost empty) and I said no, I would like a table... so she sits me beside the only people in the place and they have a screaming baby...

This used to be my go to TGI Fridays but it seems to have been disappointing the last couple of visits. It seems this one does not even have the same menu as the others. For example, I went to another location a few days before and had all different flavors of wings. This location offers a third of the other one. As far as service it was decent enough. The waiter made a point of sating he was new and he did keep our glasses filled. The one major drawback was at the payment of the check. My friend had a digital emailed coupon he wanted to us. So the server proceeds to take his phone to the back to show the manager. Any other location would have written down the code to apply it. What's worse is the server was gone for about 20 more minutes with the phone. That's just too long! So my friend asked another server about the phone and his response was that we could have printed it out. In this day and age of technology that seemed like a lame response. My friend finally got his phone back and we paid and left. After this time, not to mention the other couple of times, I don't think I'll be coming back to this location. I'll keep my business in the Addison location.
Stacie was our bartender! She is amazing! And we absolutely love her!!  We came in really late and she still took amazing care of us. The round Rock location is the best place to go(:

I have been to Friday's before but this was the first and last time going to this location. I can't even believe how this place is still open. We were immediately seated but after sitting down for 15 minutes we finally flagged down a server passing by. Who sent over the manager,  who was overwhelmed. Mind you there were 2 party of six tables that were already seated. This completely overwhelmed this place. The dining room was mostly empty on a Saturday evening. We had to ask for simple things like water, our waiter never came by the table the manager took the order and we were rushed. We as in my sister and I. I would recommend going to Trader Joe's if you are hungry and grabbing a tv dinner before going to this place. HORRIBLE!!!

My wife had weird craving for potatoe skins & after Chilis discontinued them from the menu. We tried a couple of fast food drive throughs with no luck. We called in an order to TGIF's @ 75/Collin Creek Mall. We showed up & sat @ the bar we got waited on quickly but from there on it was a lonely outpost? The bartender & a waitress started haggling about something & everybody left? We told them we had a go order to pick up when I ordered a beer. My wife meanwhile has discovered a methane/sewer smell:( Then she discovered 1 of her flip flops was stuck to the floor \m/ I finished my beer & left a fiver as we couldn't get any check out assistance. Walking out they arrived with our go order. We paid up & we'll have to update y'all after grilling the chicken to go with the tator skins. CD

Worst place you can eat out on a Saturday night! Appetizers get ordered wrong despite restaurant not being busy. Orders take 32 mins for appetizers, food is way under cook and chicken taste like rubber!  I ordered the supposedly"awesome burger" asked to be cooked well done- nothing exciting. All they did was cook the outside and slap a cheese -- lettuce was dry and 1 onion on it. Burger was under cook -  Never again!
Sat at the table for 35 minutes waiting on appetizers and food. The server kept promising that everything was just about to come out. And all of this with only 5 other tables in the restaurant.
This location must be going out of business. Third time in a row that they out of something. It's Fat Tuesday they can't make Hurricanes because they don't have any orange juice.

The food was not good. I ordered the "new" fish and chips and I have had better at a fast food restaurant. The fish was over cooked and you get 3 very small pieces. The coleslaw was not good at all, the dressing they used with it was disgusting and tasted nothing like the coleslaw you are used to of. The only good thing about our night was the service. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. My spouse got the blacked fish and the portion size was very small and not worth the cost. We will not be going back. I was not impressed at all.

This location of Fridays is horrible. Ordered the endless appetizers and 1st set of appetizers came out cold. Waiter never brought us plates to eat appetizers on. Asked for manager, she came and brought our food. Asked for appetizers to be taken off our ticket. My husband order jack Daniel's burger it's  $2. Extra and they brought him a bacon cheeseburger with a side of Jack Daniel's sauce. Waiter never came to check on us and when he brought ticket, it had appetizers on it. Ribs were so overcooked they were rubbery.

Got here at 2pm on a Saturday, took and hour and half for our food when it wasn't busy. Upon receiving our food we found hair in two of the four plates we had ordered. 2 long strands of blonde and black facial hair. None of us had blonde hair!! Wanted to throw up, told our waiter who didn't act surprised. Save your money and go anywhere else.

Save your money-don't even worry about coming to this place. Spend a couple of extra dollars more and go somewhere down the street like BJ's restaurant. There are plenty of other good places to eat in this area instead of this Fridays. I ordered a jack Daniels bourbon barrel chicken that came with mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli. The plate they brought it out was very huge but the amount of food offered was quite small. There appeared to be about one scoop of steamed broccoli and a scoop or two of mashed potatoes.  The chicken tasted rubbery and on par with something you would get at a fast food restaurant.  The only thing on the plate that was good was the steamed broccoli, and there wasn't much of that. That was $12.  I also ordered a whiskey cake dessert with a scoop of ice cream. The menu photo made it look a heck of a lot bigger and better. It had a good taste to it, but it wasn't very big and for $8, I was expecting something more. I sat at the bar and the bartender, Barbara, was fairly nice and friendly. The bar was clean except it had a very peculiar smell to it. It had one of those musky dirty bar smells and I don't think I would sit at the bar again.  The rest of the restaurant looked fairly clean but there weren't many customers. The smell coming from behind the bar was enough to almost make me not want to finish eating. I was in there at about 2 PM and it took about 20-25 minutes for the kitchen to get done with the food. The bartender had to go back twice to see what was taking so long and there probably weren't but about 10 people in the entire restaurant dining. Overall, this place does not compare to the Fridays in Addison on beltline. I don't know if it is a franchise and the management just doesn't care, but the food wasn't good, the bar smelled, service was slow and the manager on duty, I think his name is Juan, isn't very friendly and seems to speak broken English. It's hard for him to communicate. One would think the restaurant would put someone in a management position that had social skills and spoke better English. Overall, value wise, you're not going to get your moneys worth at this restaurant. Like I mentioned, spend a couple extra dollars and go somewhere else in the area. You'll get better food, better service and a better environment. I'm surprised this restaurant is still open and can't see how it will stay open much longer.

Like many other people have said, the wait for the food was unacceptably long (over 30 minutes for 4 entrees) and the steak was badly charred on one side and the salmon undercooked. If you have time to kill, like burned or raw food, or are just waiting to get hungry, this is the perfect place for you! If, on the other hand, you have a life, expect food to be properly cooked, or go to a restaurant because you're hungry, then go somewhere else.

I haven't been to a Fridays in awhile but it is a typical Fridays environment. It wasn't super packed and it still took around 45-60 mins for our food to come out. In that time no one came to check up on us or let us know the status of our food. I decided to try the sirloin and I ordered it medium rare. When I finally got it, they cooked the outside way too long and it was all burned. I didn't send it back since it took so long for the food to get there. I spent most of my dinner cutting the charcoal sides off. I was not pleased with service or the food. Either go to another restaurant or another location.

Took my daughter here 3/20/17 for her birthday. Well hardly anyone there, probably about 4 tables and this was dinner time. Took forever for our food, our food was cold and not good at all. My daughter had a burger and by the 2nd bite her bun was soggy. The fries were cold, my food that I ordered was dry (chicken) Such a disappointment for a family night for my birthday girl. We could not believe how long it took for our food considering NO one was there. So bad. I told my husband that having a meal like this, I would never want to come back to this restaurant. Not good.

After waiting 20 minutes for a server Waited another 30 minutes for our food to get ready, then another 10 minutes to get a side order of fries that came w/ the burger.  The female server was more attentive than our actual server, and she took our entire order.  Probably will not be back to this Location.

If there was a zero star I would.  Serves we're ok but wow this restaurant is a mess !! My table was split into 3 servers because it took 20 mins to get served. I ordered a chicken sandwich and didn't get the fries with it. I ate my sandwich and fries where still not out. I ordered drinks and didn't it get them until I had to ask for them again... 10mins later.  Don't come to this location.

Friday's just isn't what it used to be.  This location is ridiculous.  TERRIBLE service!  Slow.  Friend and I here on a Saturday night at 9:00. Restaurant half full.  Both of us ordered endless apps.  Even though we ordered at same time every refill, mine always took 3x longer to come out than his.  As I write this I've been waiting a good 15 minutes for potstickers.  Their only saving grace is the apps came out hot.  Meatballs and potstickers are good.  Potato skins not great.  Not crispy enough.  Bottom line:  avoid and find something place else.
Super tasty food and the Mini Pretzels appetizer is to die for! We ordered another just to take home with us for later.
As of April 15, 2017, this place is permanently closed. Bummer, it had been there for decades. I remember it from when I first came to Plano in the late 80's.

It's no wonder this place is closed. I ate here for my birthday 2/5/2017. My waiter was so scatterbrained it was cringe to watch and sweating. Forget stuff and would have to ask a few times. I was there longer than i should have been just for a dining experience for 2. Middle of the day and it was empty. The food was just OK. Didn't like it all that much. I had a simple shrimp with some fries. I think it was a little too spicy which i never ordered it spicy but they like to pack on the spice for the flavor i guess. The area around collin creek and this fridays is really going down hill.
